https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/resources/sql_injection.html

Section: Defenses in the Network

questions.question_text: Which solution should a network administrator deploy to protect a webserver from SQL injection attacks?

choices.D: deep packet inspection on IPsec encapsulated traffic
choices.C: traffic filtering by using a Security Intelligence policy
choices.B: interoperates by using GET VPN on tunnel interfaces
choices.A: application bandwidth enforcement on Cisco IOS platforms

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
provides deep visibility into network traffic, enabling administrators to identify and classify applications, monitor performance, and enforce policies based on application-specific criteria

Selected Answer: A
Application Visibility and Control (AVC) is a technology that involves multiple components, including Network Based Application Recognition Version 2 (NBAR2), Flexible NetFlow (FNF), and management tools that provide powerful application visibility and control capabilities based on stateful deep packet inspection

questions.question_text: What is a capability of Cisco AVC?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
When configuring a Cisco Secure Web Appliance (formerly Cisco Web Security Appliance - WSA) with a policy for HTTPS traffic, you need to define how the appliance should handle invalid certificates during HTTPS inspection.

ðŸ”¹ Reject:

 If a certificate is invalid (expired, mismatched, or otherwise untrusted), the appliance will reject the connection.
 This is the most secure option, as it prevents potentially malicious traffic from proceeding.

Selected Answer: C
In the context of invalid certificate handling on the Cisco Secure Web Appliance, the Accept option is used to allow the HTTPS connection to continue even if the certificate is invalid. This option is configured in a way that allows the WSA to handle cases where certificates are not fully trusted or are expired but still allow the connection to proceed.

questions.question_text: Which parameter must be set for an invalid certificate handling on a Cisco Seucure Web Appliance with a policy for HTTPS traffic?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Change native vlan

The answers are badly worded. Most probably, it is about a unique vlan id for the native vlan (different from the default vlan 1)
https://www.ciscopress.com/articles/article.asp?p=1681033&seqNum=3

https://learningnetwork.cisco.com/s/blogs/a0D3i000002SKPREA4/vlan1-and-vlan-hopping-attack

https://learningnetwork.cisco.com/s/question/0D53i00000KssdaCAB/native-vlan-tagging

Some chances are that they meant the native vlan tagging.

comments.content: Adding native in front of vlan in option A makes a lot of sense.

questions.question_text: A networking team must harden an organization's network from VLAN hopping attacks. The team disables Dynamic Trunking Protocol and puts any unused ports in an unused VLAN. A trunk port is used as a trunk link. What must the team configure next to harden the network against VLAN hopping attacks?

choices.B: disable STP on the network devices
choices.A: dedicated VLAN ID for all trunk ports
choices.C: DHCP snooping on all the switches

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
ike phase 1 passes so that means the peer ips are ok including the preshared key
phase 2 is the encryption domain. 
Answer C

Selected Answer: C
I believe the answer is C. encryption domain - this is the "interesting traffic" that is meant to be encrypted. If I'm not mistaken, the other options are all performed in phase 1 and phase 1 is up.

questions.question_text: A network engineer configures a site-to-site VPN with a colleague. During testing, the engineer discovers that only phase 1 is up, and application traffic cannot pass. Which configuration parameter must be checked on each device?
